definition:
A &%GunCylinder is the cylindrical, rotating part of
a &%RevolverGun containing multiple chambers, each of which is capable of holding a single cartridge.
The cylinder rotates (revolves) around a central axis in the revolver's action to sequentially
align each individual chamber with the barrel bore for repeated firing.[Wikipedia]
opposite_reasoning: Magazine is the best opposite for GunCylinder because: (1) Both are ammunition feeding mechanisms in firearms, making them taxonomically related but functionally mutually exclusive; (2) They represent different design solutions to the same problem (multiple-shot capacity); (3) Magazine has high availability in both WordNet and SUMO; (4) The opposition is semantically meaningful - revolvers use cylinders, semi-automatics use magazines; (5) For Fisher-LDA, this provides clear differentiation within the firearm component space. While AbstractEntity has stronger ontological opposition, Magazine provides more useful semantic granularity at the appropriate level of abstraction for a Layer 3 concept.
